Module FoundationsF25_2
Package guiNewAccount

Class ViewNewAccount

java.lang.Object
guiNewAccount.ViewNewAccount
public class ViewNewAccount extends Object

Title: ViewNewAccount Class.

Description: The ViewNewAccount Page is used to enable a potential user with an invitation code to establish an account after they have specified an invitation code on the standard login page.

Copyright: Lynn Robert Carter Â© 2025

Version:
1.00 2025-08-19 Initial version
Author:
Lynn Robert Carter

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewNewAccount

      private ViewNewAccount()

      Constructor: ViewNewAccount()

      Description: This constructor is called just once, the first time a new account needs to be created. It establishes all of the common GUI widgets for the page so they are only created once and reused when needed. The do

  • Method Details

    • displayNewAccount

      public static void displayNewAccount(javafx.stage.Stage ps, String ic)

      Method: displayNewAccount(Stage ps, String ic)

      Description: This method is the single entry point from outside this package to cause the NewAccount page to be displayed. It first sets up very shared attributes so we don't have to pass parameters. It then checks to see if the page has been setup. If not, it instantiates the class, initializes all the static aspects of the GUI widgets (e.g., location on the page, font, size, and any methods to be performed). After the instantiation, the code then populates the elements that change based on the user and the system's current state. It then sets the Scene onto the stage, and makes it visible to the user.

      Parameters:
      ps - specifies the JavaFX Stage to be used for this GUI and it's methods
      ic - specifies the user's invitation code for this GUI and it's methods

    • setupLabelUI

      private void setupLabelUI(javafx.scene.control.Label l, String ff, double f, double w, javafx.geometry.Pos p, double x, double y)
      Private local method to initialize the standard fields for a label
      Parameters:
      l - The Label object
      ff - Font family
      f - Font size
      w - Label width
      p - Alignment (e.g., Pos.CENTER)
      x - X-axis position
      y - Y-axis position

    • setupButtonUI

      private void setupButtonUI(javafx.scene.control.Button b, String ff, double f, double w, javafx.geometry.Pos p, double x, double y)
      Private local method to initialize the standard fields for a button
      Parameters:
      b - The Button object to be initialized
      ff - The font to be used
      f - The size of the font to be used
      w - The width of the Button
      p - The alignment (e.g. left, centered, or right)
      x - The location from the left edge (x axis)
      y - The location from the top (y axis)
